poem:
**Pixel 9 Pro**

Compact splendor in hand,
gleaming as the dawn,
smaller, yet no compromise
of the grand machine;
each pixel, a heart beating,
each frame, a universe.
In palm's embrace,
a world distilled, precise,
balancing the vast measure
of innovation's touch,
light as breath, 
bold as morning's promise.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pixel 9 Pro review: a real contender for the best small phone The Pixel 9 Pro is a rare beast: a smaller phone that keeps the same bold design, specs and camera as Google’s biggest and most expensive model. It makes it an instant contender for the best small phone going. At £999 (€1,099/$999/A$1,699), it is cheaper than its larger Pixel 9 Pro XL sibling but still firmly in the high-end bracket. What sets it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
